oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Interview - Curly Seckler - 2005-10-26 - Tape one of two
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Interview with Curly Seckler from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on October 26, 2005. Tape two of one. Interview moderated by Eddie Stubbs and includes biographer Penny Parsons. Program follows the screening of an hour-long preview of the oral history documentary of Curly Seckler produced by the International Bluegrass Music Museum.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Eddie Stubbs; Penny Parsons; Curly Seckler;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Recording begins in progress. Opening comments from Jay Orr. Introduction of Eddie Stubbs. Introduction of Curly Seckler. Subjects include; Early show appearances -- Early days -- Penny Parsons talks about seeing Curly for the first time and beginning of their friendship -- Curly's importance to Flatt and Scruggs and the Foggy Mountain Boys -- working with the Sauceman Brothers -- Jim and Jesse McReynolds -- The Stanley Brothers -- Working with Benny Martin -- Working with Red Allen -- The McCormick Brothers -- Bluegrass being considered as country music -- Flatt and Scruggs playing for dances -- Singing and working with Lester Flatt -- Warming up Dr. Pepper to help him sing -- Flatt and Scruggs first bus story -- Working in Huntington, West Virginia -- Lester eating hot dogs story -- Working with Leonard Stokes and Cas Walker in Knoxville -- Penny Parsons inspiration for writing her biography on Seckler -- Working with Bill Monroe --
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Stubbs, Eddie; Seckler, Curly, 1919- ; Parsons, Penny; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
